addl_params.title: Additional Parameters
addl_params.description: Google APIs tend to have many optional additional paramters. This property allows a configurer to add and remove optional parameters with minimal overhead. To use these properties, just call the get_addl_params method when reporting url parameters in the subclass

include_query.title: Include Query Field
include_query.description: Whether to include queries on polling requests.

lookback_days.title: Lookback Days (inclusive)
lookback_days.description: Amount of days to look back when polling.

pretty_results.title: Pretty Results
pretty_results.description: Whether or not to return readable results from Google. The raw response contains richer information but is harder to parse. By checking this, the results will be parsed and split into more readable signals. Recommended to be checked unless you need some advanced information from the Google API

reauth_interval.title: Reauthenticate Interval
reauth_interval.description: Time in between authentications with Google

retry_limit.title: Retry Limit
retry_limit.description: Max number of times to retry authentication

default.description: An output signal of the queried analytics data. Details of the Google Analytics data can be found [here](https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/reporting/core/v3/reference#data_response).
